bibl.title: Letter from Richard B. Russell to Philip Showalter Hench, April 24, 1956

div1.p: Russell appreciates Hench's letter regarding Lambert's inclusion in the Roll of Honor. He is unable to predict when the bill will be up for consideration.

div1.head: Letter from Richard B. Russell to Philip Showalter Hench, April 24, 1956
div1.opener:
RICHARD B. RUSSELL, GA., CHAIRMAN
HARRY FLOOD BYRD, VA.
LYNDON B. JOHNSON, TEX.
ESTES KEFAUVER, TENN.
JOHN STENNIS, MISS.
STUART SYMINGTON, MO.
HENRY M. JACKSON, WASH.
SAM J. ERVIN, JR., N. C.
LEVERETT SALTONSTALL, MASS.
STYLES BRIDGES, N. H.
RALPH E. FLANDERS, VT.
MARGARET CHASE SMITH, MAINE
FRANCIS CASE, S. DAK.
JAMES H. DUFF, PA.
HERMAN WELKER, IDAHO
HARRY L. WINGATE, JR., CHIEF CLERK
United States Senate
COMMITTEE ON ARMED SERVICES
April 24, 1956
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Permit me to acknowledge and thank you for your
letter with further reference to H.R. 5590, which would
add the name of Mr. Gustaf E. Lambert to the Roll of
Honor in connection with the discovery of the cause and
means of transmission of yellow fever.

I very much appreciate having the benefit of your
extensive research and your recommendation that Mr.
Lambert be appropriately honored, but not by adding his
name to the Roll of Honor.

Because of the pendency of several major legisla-
tive items requiring the Committee's attention in the
near future, I am unable to predict just when this bill
may be reached for consideration. I believe that you
will have ample time to summarize the documentary
material that you have and I shall see that you are
notified as far in advance as possible when this bill
can be set for Committee action.

closer.salute:
With best wishes, I am
Sincerely,
